content:
Hi @Rob Hausam ,

Will the september 2019 balloted version of IPS contain content aligned with US-Core R4?

Thanks,

Joel

Hi Rob Hausam ,

Will the september 2019 balloted version of IPS contain content aligned with US-Core R4?

Thanks,

Joel

@Giorgio Cangioli , can you please help answer?
I believe that the answer is yes

Hi Rob Hausam ,

Will the september 2019 balloted version of IPS contain content aligned with US-Core R4?

Thanks,

Joel

Giorgio Cangioli , can you please help answer?

Thanks @Grahame Grieve

Hi Joel,
yes one of the intent of this version is to facilitate the harmonization between Argonaut/US Core and IPS, considering however that they have slightly different scopes. This version hopes also to provide a better support for the local adoption of the IPS (i.e. not only for cross-border)

Apologies for the slow reply, @Joel Francis Yes, as Grahame and Giorgio said. Alignment with Argonaut is a primary reason for going to ballot again in September - and our intent is to align as closely as possible (especially structurally) while remaining international in the IPS spec.

Apologies for the slow reply, Joel Francis Yes, as Grahame and Giorgio said. Alignment with Argonaut is a primary reason for going to ballot again in September - and our intent is to align as closely as possible (especially structurally) while remaining international in the IPS spec.

Thank you @Rob Hausam and @Giorgio Cangioli
